intro: Holocheilus, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plants are native to various regions in the Mediterranean and parts of Asia. Holocheilus species often thrive in well-drained soils and full sun, making them suitable for rock gardens and borders. Their ornamental value is enhanced by their long blooming period and ability to attract pollinators.
